The Acela Express is Amtrak's flagship service along the Northeast Corridor (NEC) in the Northeast United States between Washington, D.C. and Boston via 14 intermediate stops including Baltimore, Philadelphia, and New York City.

The Shinkansen is a network of high-speed railway lines in Japan. Initially built to connect distant Japanese regions with Tokyo, the capital, in order to aid economic growth and development, Shinkansen (literally: "new trunk line") has since evolved into a network of lines serving major cities, including Tokyo, Nagoya, Osaka, Hiroshima, Fukuoka, and Sendai.
